item.title: Federal Judge Extends Deportation Protections for Burmese Migrants
item.description: The ruling represents another setback in the Trump administration’s mass deportation campaign.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron
item.media:description: A federal judge wrote an opinion hat there was significant evidence that Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem’s decision to end Temporary Protected Status for Burmese immigrants was arbitrary and capricious.

item.title: Pepper-Sprayed While Pinned Down: A Searing Scene Provokes Outrage
item.description: Images of a man getting pepper-sprayed at close range while being held down by Border Patrol agents fueled more tension in Minneapolis.
item.dc:creator: Ernesto Londoño
item.media:description: Border Patrol agents deployed pepper spray while holding down a man on Wednesday in Minneapolis.

item.title: U.S. Says First Boat Strike Since Maduro’s Capture Killed 2 in Eastern Pacific
item.description: The U.S. Southern Command said it had asked the Coast Guard to search for one survivor.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Ahn
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )
item.media:credit: U.S. Southern Command, via Associated Press
item.media:description: An image from a video released by the U.S. Southern Command showing a vessel accused of trafficking drugs in the eastern Pacific Ocean on Friday.

item.title: ICE Agent Charged With Misdemeanor Following Scuffle With an Activist
item.description: The police in Brookfield, Ill., filed a battery charge against a federal agent, who was off duty when he scuffled with an immigrant rights activist.
item.dc:creator: Danny Hakim
item.media:credit: Carlos Javier Ortiz for The New York Times
item.media:description: The Broadview Processing Center has been the center of a number of anti-ICE protests in recent weeks.

item.title: HUD Demands Public Housing Officials Check for Undocumented Immigrants
item.description: The Department of Housing and Urban Development said it would punish public housing authorities that did not adequately verify tenants’ immigration status within 30 days.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron
item.media:description: Public housing on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. A spokesman for the city’s Housing Authority said in a statement that the federal government already required documentation of all tenants’ citizenship status.

item.title: S.E.C. Drops Case Against Cryptocurrency Firm Founded by Winklevoss Twins
item.description: The agency says that victims of an investment offering involving Gemini Trust got their money back, though after a regulatory action brought by the New York attorney general.
item.dc:creator: Ben Protess and Sharon LaFraniere
item.media:credit: Haiyun Jiang for The New York Times
item.media:description: Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss at a digital assets summit at the White House last March.

item.title: Vance Announces Expansion of ‘Mexico City Rule’ to Cover D.E.I. and ‘Radical’ Gender Policies
item.description: The change, which could affect more than $30 billion in foreign assistance, is the Trump administration’s latest move against what the president calls “woke ideology.”
item.dc:creator: Michael Crowley
item.media:description: Vice President JD Vance at the annual March for Life in Washington on Friday.

item.title: Joint Chiefs Chairman Issues Rare Invitation to Foreign Military Heads
item.description: Top military leaders from 34 countries plan to discuss improving efforts in the Western Hemisphere to fight drug trafficking and transnational criminal organizations.
item.dc:creator: Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: Gen. Dan Caine’s meeting comes at a fraught time for Washington’s relations with its immediate neighbors as well as allies in Europe.

item.title: Are Republicans Growing a Little Uneasy About the ICE Raids?
item.description: Polls, careful remarks from JD Vance and chats with voters all point to some wariness.
item.dc:creator: Katie Glueck
item.media:description: Federal immigration agents in Minneapolis.

item.title: FBI Agent Resigns After Trying to Investigate ICE Officer in Renee Good Shooting
item.description: The resignation of the agent, Tracee Mergen, was only the latest shock wave to have emerged from the Justice Department’s handling of the shooting of Renee Good.
item.dc:creator: Alan Feuer and Glenn Thrush
item.media:description: Police and federal agents at the scene where an Immigration and Customs Enforcement agent fatally shot Renee Good in Minneapolis this month.

item.title: Colorado Authorities Confirm Suicide by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: After a monthslong review, investigators have concluded that “all speculative theories could not be substantiated.”
item.dc:creator: Tim Arango
item.media:description: Hunter S. Thompson in 1997.

item.title: Trump’s Turnabout on Greenland Shows the Limits of His Coercive Powers
item.description: President Trump’s faith in his ability to wring concessions by taking maximalist positions was on full display this week. So were the costs, as he splintered NATO and then undercut his credibility by climbing down from his threats.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:description: President Donald J. Trump on Air Force One en route to Washington on Thursday night.

item.title: Saudi Arabia-Backed LIV Golf to Hold Tournament at the Trumps’ New Jersey Resort
item.description: It will be the latest in at least half a dozen events that the breakaway league has held at Trump Organization resorts in the past four years.
item.dc:creator: Sharon LaFraniere
item.media:credit: Scott McIntyre for The New York Times
item.media:description: Besides events at Bedminster, the golf league has held annual tournaments at the Trump Doral resort in Miami.

item.title: Couple Receive $200,000 Settlement After ‘Pungent’ Indian Food Complaint
item.description: The University of Colorado, Boulder, denied liability in the civil rights lawsuit, which the couple filed after a comment about a dish that one of them was heating in an office microwave.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levenson

item.title: Bovino Says ICE and Border Patrol Agents Are ‘Experts in Dealing With Children’
item.description: A picture of a 5-year-old detained by federal authorities near Minneapolis rocketed around the internet and became an avatar of outrage. Immigrant advocates say Homeland Security has mistreated children for years.
item.dc:creator: Shaila Dewan and Miriam Jordan
item.media:description: The detention of Liam on Tuesday provoked a storm of public criticism. The child’s school district and the federal government have given conflicting accounts of his detention.

item.title: Defending His Absence in House, Hunt Celebrates Casting a Vote
item.description: House leaders were forced to rush Representative Wesley Hunt, Republican of Texas, to the Capitol with a police escort to avoid an embarrassing defeat on the floor.
item.dc:creator: Annie Karni
item.media:description: Representative Wesley Hunt, Republican of Texas, has missed 95 percent of roll call votes since Dec. 18.

item.title: At March for Life, Some Abortion Opponents Want More From Trump
item.description: At the March for Life, Vice President JD Vance acknowledged “a fear that some of you have that not enough progress has been made.”
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Dias
item.media:credit: Caroline Gutman for The New York Times
item.media:description: Abortion opponents gathered in Washington on Friday for the annual March for Life.

item.title: Labor Secretary’s Security Guard Placed on Leave
item.description: The department has been investigating complaints about the conduct of Secretary Lori Chavez-DeRemer.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Davis O’Brien
item.media:credit: Al Drago for The New York Times
item.media:description: Allegations about the conduct of Labor Secretary Lori Chavez-DeRemer are part of broader dissatisfaction and turmoil during her tenure, current and former employees of the department said.

item.title: A Republican Vaccine Defender Fights to Hang On
item.description: Senator Bill Cassidy of Louisiana, a physician, reluctantly voted to confirm Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as health secretary. It didn’t appease President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Katie Glueck
item.media:description: Senator Bill Cassidy’s re-election bid was upended last week President Trump endorsed a challenger, imperiling the senator’s already-shaky standing with Republicans back home.

item.title: 5 Arrested in Shooting of Indiana Judge Steven Meyer and His Wife
item.description: The police said the attack was part of a plot to kill Judge Steven Meyer to halt a trial he was to conduct. He and his wife were injured but are recovering.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Saul
item.media:description: Steven Meyer, a judge of the Tippecanoe County Superior Court, and his wife, Kimberly, were shot on Sunday at their home in Lafayette, Ind.

item.title: Here’s the latest.
item.dc:creator: J. David Goodman and Amy Graff

item.title: Democrats Seek Maxwell Prison Visit, Citing Preferential Treatment
item.description: House Democrats told the attorney general that more than a dozen whistle-blowers had come forward with reports of Ghislaine Maxwell receiving perks in prison.
item.dc:creator: Michael Gold
item.category: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
item.media:description: Ghislaine Maxwell’s time at the federal prison camp in Bryan, Texas, has been a focus of significant backlash since she was relocated there last summer.

item.title: Trump Says He Bruised His Hand on a Table
item.description: The president also said he was prone to bruising because of the high dose of aspirin he has taken daily for three decades.
item.dc:creator: Claire Moses

item.title: Portland, Maine, Feels Like a Small Town — And ICE Isn’t Welcome
item.description: The influx of federal agents this week has been hard for locals to ignore. Many are expressing their resistance to the immigration crackdown.
item.dc:creator: Jenna Russell
item.media:credit: Sophie Park for The New York Times
item.media:description: The federal immigration offensive began in Maine this week, the latest in a series of similar campaigns in cities across the country.

item.title: Hundreds of Minnesota Businesses on Strike in Protest Against ICE
item.description: Thousands of protesters shut down streets throughout Minneapolis-St. Paul to demand that federal immigration agents end their weekslong crackdown. Businesses closed in solidarity.
item.dc:creator: Chris Hippensteel, Talya Minsberg, Maia Coleman and Summer Rabold
item.media:description: Thousands of protesters shut down parts of Minneapolis and St. Paul on Friday as hundreds of businesses closed their doors.

item.title: Voters Are Split on Deportations but Disapprove of ICE, Poll Finds
item.description: While roughly half of voters support President Trump’s handling of the border between the United States and Mexico, a sizable majority says that ICE’s tactics have “gone too far.”
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Medina and Ruth Igielnik

item.title: Increased Scrutiny Leads to an Improved Organ Transplant System
item.description: A crackdown on problems with fairness and safety is achieving results, including a big drop in the number of sick patients being passed over for transplants.
item.dc:creator: Brian M. Rosenthal
item.media:credit: Alyssa Schukar for The New York Times
item.media:description: A medical worker holding a recovered kidney.

item.title: The Whipple Building Is at the Center of Minnesota’s Immigration Drama
item.description: Just outside Minneapolis, the Whipple Building houses offices, a detention center and a courthouse — and has become the home base for immigration agents and protesters alike.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
item.media:description: Federal officers facing off against protesters outside the Whipple Federal Building in Minneapolis earlier this month.

item.title: Jasmine Crockett and James Talarico Face Off in a Texas Senate Primary Campaign
item.description: Two of the Democrats’ rising stars, Jasmine Crockett and James Talarico, are seeing if a red state should be won courting disaffected Republicans or focusing on the party’s base.
item.dc:creator: J. David Goodman
item.media:credit: Jordan Vonderhaar for The New York Times
